ARTICLE.TITLE: US, Canada, Mexico extend travel ban to September
ARTICLE.TEXT:
The United States, Canada and Mexico have extended their travel ban until September.

The US Department of Homeland Security in a tweet on Friday said the COVID-19 ban on non-essential travel through border crossings with Canada and Mexico has being extended until September 21.

The reciprocal travel ban aimed at slowing the spread of coronavirus was first imposed in March and has been extended several times.

The United States has experienced a recent surge in COVID-19 cases and with more than 5.2 million infections has more than any other country in the world.
